info.name: Quicksol Real Estate API
info.description:
Complete API collection for QuickSol Real Estate Management System.

## Features
- Multi-tenancy with company isolation
- RBAC: 9 security profiles
- User Onboarding & Password Management (Feature 009)
- Properties, Agents, Leads management
- Commission tracking and performance
- Owner & Company management
- Complete Assignment CRUD

## Authentication Flow
1. **Get OAuth Token**: POST /api/v1/auth/token
2. **User Login**: POST /api/v1/users/login (returns session_id)
3. **Use Both**: Authorization header + session_id in body (POST) or X-Openerp-Session-Id header (GET)

## Headers
- `Authorization: Bearer {{access_token}}`
- `X-Openerp-Session-Id: {{session_id}}` (REQUIRED for GET requests)
- `User-Agent: {{user_agent}}`
- `Content-Type: application/json`

## Important Notes (ADR-016)
- ⚠️ **POST/PUT/PATCH**: `session_id` goes in **body JSON** (not header)
- ⚠️ **GET requests**: `session_id` goes in **header** `X-Openerp-Session-Id`
- ⚠️ **No JSON-RPC**: Business endpoints send JSON directly in body
- ✅ **Variables**: Use {{...}} for all authentication values
- ✅ **Test Scripts**: OAuth and Login endpoints auto-save tokens

## Changelog v1.10
- **NEW**: User Onboarding & Password Management (Feature 009)
- POST /api/v1/users/invite - Invite users with RBAC authorization matrix (9 profiles)
- POST /api/v1/users/{id}/resend-invite - Resend invitation email (rate limited)
- POST /api/v1/auth/set-password - Set password from invite token (public endpoint)
- POST /api/v1/auth/forgot-password - Request password reset (anti-enumeration, rate limited)
- POST /api/v1/auth/reset-password - Reset password with token (invalidates all sessions)
- Portal dual record creation: res.users + real.estate.tenant atomic creation
- Token security: UUID v4 → SHA-256 hashing, TTL configurable (1-720h, default 24h)
- Authorization matrix: Owner (all 9 profiles), Manager (5 operational), Agent (owner+portal)
- Anti-enumeration pattern on forgot-password (always returns 200)
- Rate limiting: 3 forgot-password requests/hour, 5 resend attempts/user

## Changelog v1.9
- **NEW**: GET /api/v1/properties - List properties with required company_ids parameter
- **BREAKING CHANGE**: GET /api/v1/assignments now requires company_ids parameter (was optional company_id)
- company_ids accepts comma-separated IDs (e.g., "63,65") for multi-company queries
- RBAC validation on both endpoints (Admin/Manager/Owner/Agent)
- Multi-tenancy security: validates user access to requested companies
- Fixed assignment serialization (removed non-existent commission_percentage field)

## Previous Versions
- v1.8: Properties endpoint with company_ids parameter
- v1.7: Create Owner with CPF validation (validate_docbr)
- v1.6: Assignment CRUD endpoints with pagination and filters
- v1.5: Fixed ADR-016 compliance, Master Data endpoints
- v1.4: Integrated Company & Owner Management (Feature 007)
- v1.3: Complete API coverage (50+ endpoints)

item.name: 2. User Invitation
item.description: User invitation endpoints with RBAC authorization matrix.

request.description:
**Authentication:** Bearer Token + Session ID required
**Multi-tenancy:** Company isolation active (@require_company)
**Fingerprint validation:** Active (IP + User-Agent)

**IMPORTANT:** Business endpoints do NOT use JSON-RPC format. Send JSON directly in body with session_id field.

**Authorization Matrix:**
- Owner: Can invite all 9 profiles
- Manager: Can invite 5 operational profiles
- Agent: Can invite owner + portal
- Others: 403 Forbidden

**Request Body:**
- `name` (required): Full name
- `email` (required): Valid email, unique
- `document` (required): CPF/CNPJ, unique
- `profile` (required): One of 9 profiles (owner, director, manager, agent, prospector, receptionist, financial, legal, portal)
- `session_id` (required): Session ID from login

**Response 201:**
```json
{
  "data": {
    "id": 123,
    "name": "John Doe Manager",
    "email": "john.manager@example.com",
    "profile": "manager",
    "invite_expires_at": "2026-02-18T10:00:00Z",
    "status": "pending"
  },
  "links": {
    "self": "/api/v1/users/123",
    "resend_invite": "/api/v1/users/123/resend-invite"
  }
}
```

**Errors:**
- 400: Invalid request (missing fields, invalid profile)
- 403: Forbidden (authorization matrix violation)
- 409: Duplicate email or document

**Portal Dual Record Creation**

Creates both:
1. `res.users` (portal group)
2. `real.estate.tenant` (linked via partner_id)

**Authentication:** Bearer Token + Session ID required
**Multi-tenancy:** Tenant belongs to inviter's company

**IMPORTANT:** Business endpoints do NOT use JSON-RPC format. Send JSON directly in body with session_id field.

**Additional Required Fields for Portal:**
- `phone` (required): Tenant phone number
- `birthdate` (required): ISO 8601 date (YYYY-MM-DD)
- `occupation` (optional): Tenant occupation
- `company_id` (optional): Defaults to inviter's company
- `session_id` (required): Session ID from login

**Response 201:**
```json
{
  "data": {
    "id": 456,
    "name": "Jane Doe Tenant",
    "email": "jane.tenant@example.com",
    "profile": "portal",
    "tenant_id": 789,
    "invite_expires_at": "2026-02-18T10:00:00Z"
  },
  "links": {
    "self": "/api/v1/users/456",
    "resend_invite": "/api/v1/users/456/resend-invite",
    "tenant": "/api/v1/tenants/789"
  }
}
```

**Errors:**
- 400: Missing phone/birthdate
- 409: Duplicate document (existing tenant without user account)

**Authentication:** Bearer Token + Session ID required
**Multi-tenancy:** Can only resend for users in same company
**Rate Limiting:** Max 5 resends per user (configurable)

**IMPORTANT:** Business endpoints do NOT use JSON-RPC format. Send JSON directly in body with session_id field.

**Behavior:**
- Invalidates previous pending invite token
- Generates new token with fresh TTL
- Sends new invite email
- Returns 429 if max resends exceeded
- Returns 404 if user not found or cross-company
- Returns 400 if user already active

**Request Body:**
- `session_id` (required): Session ID from login

**Response 200:**
```json
{
  "data": {
    "user_id": 123,
    "email": "john.manager@example.com",
    "invite_expires_at": "2026-02-18T12:00:00Z",
    "resend_count": 2,
    "max_resends": 5
  },
  "message": "Invitation email sent successfully"
}
```

item.name: 2. Password Management
item.description: Public password management endpoints (set, forgot, reset).

request.description:
**Authentication:** None (public endpoint)
**Token Source:** Invite email

**IMPORTANT:** This is a PUBLIC endpoint. No OAuth token or session required.

**Request Body:**
- `token` (required): Raw token from invite email (UUID format)
- `password` (required): New password (min 8 chars)
- `confirm_password` (required): Must match password

**Token Validation:**
- Token must exist and match SHA-256 hash
- Token must have type='invite'
- Token status must be 'pending'
- Token must not be expired (TTL check)

**Password Requirements:**
- Minimum 8 characters
- Must match confirm_password

**Response 200:**
```json
{
  "message": "Password set successfully. You can now log in.",
  "links": {
    "login": "/api/v1/users/login"
  }
}
```

**Errors:**
- 400: Password validation failed (< 8 chars, passwords don't match)
- 410: Token expired, used, or invalid

**Authentication:** None (public endpoint)
**Anti-Enumeration Pattern (ADR-008):** Always returns 200

**IMPORTANT:** This endpoint ALWAYS returns 200 OK with same response, regardless of whether email exists or not. This prevents user enumeration attacks.

**Request Body:**
- `email` (required): Email address to send reset link

**Behavior (if email exists and user is active):**
1. Invalidates previous pending reset tokens
2. Generates new reset token (type='reset')
3. Sends reset email with token link
4. Rate limiting check (3 requests/hour)

**Behavior (if email doesn't exist or user inactive):**
1. Returns same 200 response
2. No email sent
3. No database changes

**Response 200 (always):**
```json
{
  "message": "If the email exists, a password reset link has been sent."
}
```

**Rate Limiting:**
- 429: If more than 3 requests in 1 hour from same IP

**Security Features:**
- Anti-enumeration (identical response for all cases)
- Rate limiting per IP
- Token expiry (default 24h)
- Previous tokens invalidated

**Authentication:** None (public endpoint)
**Token Source:** Reset password email

**IMPORTANT:** This is a PUBLIC endpoint. No OAuth token or session required.

**Request Body:**
- `token` (required): Raw token from reset email (UUID format)
- `password` (required): New password (min 8 chars)
- `confirm_password` (required): Must match password

**Token Validation:**
- Token must exist and match SHA-256 hash
- Token must have type='reset'
- Token status must be 'pending'
- Token must not be expired (TTL check)

**Password Requirements:**
- Minimum 8 characters
- Must match confirm_password

**Side Effects:**
- Password updated
- Token marked as 'used'
- **ALL active sessions invalidated** (is_active=false in api_session table)
- User must login again after reset

**Response 200:**
```json
{
  "message": "Password reset successfully. Please log in with your new password.",
  "links": {
    "login": "/api/v1/users/login"
  }
}
```

**Errors:**
- 400: Password validation failed
- 410: Token expired, used, or invalid

**Security Note:** All previous sessions are invalidated to prevent unauthorized access after password reset.
